text: emerging from crisp blue skies this was
the helicopter that began the rescue of
52 people trapped in the Antarctic it's
taken 11 days three ships in this
aircraft to reach the scientists
tourists and crew stuck aboard the
Russian ship the Akademik shokalskiy
this is a dramatic end to an adventurous
scientific mission those on board the
ship had set out to retrace the steps of
Victorian explorer Douglas Mawson but a
turn in the weather meant they've been
left with their own unique story to tell
footage from a failed rescue attempt by
the icebreaker Aurora Australis shows
how thick sheets of ice driven by strong
winds trapped both it and the Schakowsky
a BBC producer Andrew Luck Baker aboard
the Australis describes the latest air
left who you are just watching then were
the last group of people to have been
ferried from the Russian vessel over
through about a 15 minute white-knuckle
ride helicopter ride - just outside the
Australian icebreaker so far all of the
Schakowsky passengers are thought to be
fit and well despite their frozen
adventure sangeeta my skirt BBC news
